abstract.text: An object that identifies the portions of your layout that need to be updated.

inlineContent.text: Invalidation contexts are a way to improve the efficiency of layout operations and must be supported explicitly by the layout object. Instead of invalidating the entire layout, you can create an invalidation layout object that specifies only the portions of the layout that changed. You then pass that invalidation context to the
Typically, you ask the layout object to create an invalidation context for you. The

class defines methods for creating a supported invalidation context. If you define a custom layout, you can define additional methods for creating invalidation contexts with custom information. Layout objects may also create invalidation contexts in response to specific changes. For example, layout objects automatically create invalidation contexts when you change the collection view’s data source, when you insert or delete items, and when you reload the collection view’s data.
If you define a custom layout object, you can also subclass

and add properties that are specific to your layout object. Creating a custom invalidation context is not required and should only be done when your layout object has additional ways to optimize the layout process.
Fore more information about how to support custom invalidation contexts in your layout objects, see

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that identifies the portions of a flow layout object that need to be updated.
An abstract base class that you subclass and use to generate layout information for a collection view.
Invalidates specific parts of the layout using the specified context object.
An object that identifies the portions of your layout that need to be updated.
The delta value to add to the collection view’s content offset.
The delta value to add to the collection view’s content size.
A Boolean that indicates whether the layout object should ask for new section and item counts.
Marks the specified decoration views as invalid so that their layout information can be updated.
A Boolean that indicates whether all layout data should be marked as invalid.
Marks the specified items as invalid so that their layout information can be updated.
Marks the specified supplementary views as invalid so that their layout information can be updated.
A dictionary containing the decoration views whose layout attributes are invalid.
The set of items whose layout attributes are invalid.
A dictionary containing the supplementary views whose layout attributes are invalid.
A description of a single change to make to an item in a collection view.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
